document_title: Purulent tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_name: viem-amidan-hoc-mu.json_7_Caring for patients with purulent tonsillitis
subsection_content:
For effective post-disease recovery and disease prevention, Associate Professor, Dr. Le Minh Ky notes that patients need to follow the following recommendations:
Drink lots of water: Tonsillitis causes the patient's body to lose a lot of water and feel tired, so the patient should drink lots of water and can use milk and fruit juice to rehydrate and supplement many nutrients. ; Drink lots of water: Tonsillitis causes the patient's body to lose a lot of water and feel tired, so the patient should drink lots of water and can use milk and fruit juice to rehydrate and supplement many nutrients.
Eat liquid foods that are easy to swallow: use liquid and soft foods such as soup, porridge, broth, etc. to improve symptoms of difficulty swallowing and sore throat when eating, as well as reduce pressure on the tonsils;; Eat liquid foods that are easy to swallow: use liquid and soft foods such as soup, porridge, broth, etc. to improve symptoms of difficulty swallowing and sore throat when eating, as well as reduce pressure on the tonsils;
Keep your teeth, nose, and throat clean: gargle with warm salt water after eating, wear a mask to avoid dust from the surrounding environment, especially in places with high levels of pollution.; Keep your teeth, nose, and throat clean: gargle with warm salt water after eating, and wear a mask to avoid dust from the surrounding environment, especially in places with high levels of pollution.
